column4: What is the name of the package for Javascript under the package manager for Ubuntu 8.04?
javascript is part of your browesr
how do i install javascript through the browser?
you already have it
you just need flash.  visit http://www.adobe.com/products/flash/about/ and click on the yellow bar
I already installed flash, but I am still getting the error message
what does the page I gave you tell you?
thanks, its working now
##c++ is probably more appropriate or #bash
I don't understand your reply.
the irc channel ##c++ is probably more appropriate or the irc channel #bash
ok, thanks
yeah, you're missing a space...
cousteau`nbk also told you that '0' should be 'o'.  If you still get the error, then the file doesn't exist in the directory you are in
I do have an "o". the file is on a CD. How do i make that a part a path?
what you pasted has a '0', not an 'o'
I know, i typed it wrong
for the path, start at / and provide the absolute path to the .iso
how do i do that if the file is on a CD?
/folder1/folder2/whateveryourfileiscalled  Probably /media/cdrom/.  If you know how to get there from the gui, then use that to aid you
after putting my cd in, i see no indication where it is located, How would i find out its location?
check /media
I found it, it was mounted on /media. thanks for your help

when I cd to /media and then do ls command, this is what I see - "Ubuntu 10.04.1 LTS i386". This is nothing like the file created when I did the download. I would have assumed that the file name on the CD would be the same as the filename. Can I use the the file name i see from the ls command?
